column1: You have an indwelling catheter (tube) in your bladder.

You will need these supplies for cleaning your skin around your catheter and for cleaning your catheter: - 2 clean washcloths - 2 clean hand towels - Mild soap - Warm water - A clean container or sink Follow these skin care guidelines once a day, every day, or more often if needed: - Wash your hands well with soap and water.
Follow these steps two times a day to keep your catheter clean and free of germs that can cause infection: - Wash your hands well with soap and water.
A urinary tract infection is the most common problem for people with an indwelling urinary catheter.

Call your health care provider if you have signs of an infection, such as: - Pain around your sides or lower back - Urine smells bad, or it is cloudy or a different color - Fever or chills - A burning sensation or pain in your bladder or pelvis - You do not feel like yourself.
